title: How Many Calories in Guac?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in guac per 100g serving, including macros like fat, carbs, protein, and tips for variations in this avocado-based dip.
assumptions: Homemade guacamole: mashed avocado, lime juice, diced onion, tomato, cilantro, garlic, and salt; no added oil or cream.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, ingredients, ripeness, and brand; homemade vs. store-bought can differ. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 100g of guacamole contains about 160 kcal, with healthy fats from avocado.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: With added jalape√±o and extra lime (minimal change)

faqs.q: How many calories in a typical serving of guac?
faqs.a: A standard 2 tbsp (about 30g) serving has ~48 kcal.
Yes, about 15g fat per 100g, mostly healthy monounsaturated from avocado.
Around 9g carbs per 100g, with 7g fiber, making net carbs low.

faqs.q: Does store-bought guac have more calories?
faqs.a: Often yes, due to added oils or preservatives; check labels for ~180-200 kcal per 100g.
Low at ~2g per 100g; pair with chips or veggies for a balanced snack.
